date_from.title: Date From
date_from.description: The date from when these properties are active. If these properties follow a change, then this Date From should equal the previous Date To. The format of this date should follow ISO 8601 with the 'T' required. If a timezone is used, it is essential that this timezone is the same as the logger timezone.

date_to.title: Date To
date_to.description: The final end date for when these properties are active. If these properties are currently active please use null. If null is not allowed please use 2100-01-01T00:00:00. The format of this date should follow ISO 8601 with the 'T' required. If a timezone is used, it is essential that this timezone is the same as the logger timezone.

notes.title: Notes
examples: I can write anything I want here.

update_at.title: Date of Update
update_at.description: The date these properties were last updated.

title: IEA Wind Resource Assessment - Data Model
description: This Data Model schema is a digital representation of a meteorological mast used for measureing the wind resource of a potential wind farm.

author.title: Author
author.description: The person or system who created this data model representing a specific mast.

organisation.title: Organisation
organisation.description: The organisation the Author is from.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date this file was created. Format should be YYYY-MM-DD

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the IEA WRA Data Model this file is based on. The format of this follows Semantic Versioning with the year and month tagged on after. E.g. 1.1.1-2020.07

plant_name.title: Plant Name
plant_name.description: The name of the wind farm this met mast is associated with.

plant_type.title: Plant Type
plant_type.description: The type of renewable generation plant it is.

measurement_location.title: Measurement Location
measurement_location.description: This is the geographic location of the meteorological measurement station i.e. a met mast/tower or remote sensing device.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name given to the measurement location i.e. to the met mast or remote sensing device.

latitude_ddeg.title: Latitude [ddeg]
latitude_ddeg.description: Latitude coordinate in the Geographic Coordinate System using the WGS84 datum in decimal degrees. Latitude lines are parallel to the equator where their position ranges from -90 degrees at the south pole to 90 degrees at the north pole.

longitude_ddeg.title: Longitude [ddeg]
longitude_ddeg.description: Longitude coordinate in the Geographic Coordinate System using the WGS84 datum in decimal degrees. Longitude lines are perpendicular to the equator where their position ranges from 0° at Greenwich Mean Time increasing to +180° as you move eastward and decreasing to −180° as you move westward.

measurement_station_type_id.title: Measurement Station Type
measurement_station_type_id.description: The type of measurement station. This must be one of either met mast, lidar (a vertical profiler), sodar (also a vertical profiler) or flidar (floating vertical profiler lidar).

mast_properties.title: Mast Properties
mast_properties.description: The properties of the installed met mast/tower.

mast_geometry_id.title: Mast Geometry
mast_geometry_id.description: The type of mast geometry e.g. lattice with a triangular profile or pole. The IEC specifies two square lattice towers as having rounded edges for their members or sharp edges.

mast_oem.title: Mast OEM
mast_oem.description: The manufacturer of the met mast.

mast_serial_number.title: Mast Serial Number
mast_serial_number.description: The manufacturer's serial number of the mast.

mast_height_m.title: Mast Height [m]
mast_height_m.description: The height of the mast itself, not necessarily the top anemometer height.

mast_section_geometry.title: Mast Section Geometry
mast_section_geometry.description: This properties of each mast section.

uuid.title: UUID
uuid.description: The unique id to relate this mast section to the mounting arrangement. A UUID can be generated here https://www.uuidgenerator.net/

pole_diameter_mm.title: Pole Diameter [mm]
pole_diameter_mm.description: If a pole mast is used, it's diameter in mm.

lattice_face_width_at_bottom_mm.title: Lattice Face Width at Bottom [mm]
lattice_face_width_at_bottom_mm.description: The lattice section bottom face width.

lattice_face_width_at_top_mm.title: Lattice Face Width at Top [mm]
lattice_face_width_at_top_mm.description: The lattice section top face width.

lattice_leg_width_mm.title: Lattice Leg Width [mm]
lattice_leg_width_mm.description: The lattice leg diameter for a round leg or width for a square cross section leg.

lattice_leg_is_round_cross_section.title: Lattice Leg is Round Cross Section
lattice_leg_is_round_cross_section.description: The lattice leg is a round or square cross section. True is for a round leg cross section and false is for a square leg cross section.
examples: true (for a round leg cross section)
false (for a square leg cross section)

lattice_bracing_member_diameter_mm.title: Lattice Bracing Member Diameter [mm]
lattice_bracing_member_diameter_mm.description: The lattice diagonal bracing member diameter.

lattice_number_of_diagonal_bracing_membe.title: Lattice Number of Bracing Members
lattice_number_of_diagonal_bracing_membe.description: The number of lattice diagonal bracing members.

lattice_bracing_member_height_mm.title: Lattice Bracing Member Height [mm]
lattice_bracing_member_height_mm.description: The height of the lattice diagonal bracing members.

lattice_has_horizontal_member.title: Does the tower have horizontal braces?
lattice_has_horizontal_member.description: This represents masts that have horizontal braces. True is for towers with horizontal braces and false is for towers without horizontal braces.

vertical_profiler_properties.title: Vertical Profiler Properties
vertical_profiler_properties.description: Vertical profiler remote sensing devices (e.g. lidar, sodar and flidar) installation specific properties.

device_datum_plane_height_m.title: Device Datum Plane Height [m]
device_datum_plane_height_m.description: The datum plane height of the remote sensing device where the datum feature is defined here: http://data.windenergy.dtu.dk/ontologies/view/ontolidar/en/page/DatumFeature . For lidars the datum feature is usually the window and for sodars it is usually the base of the device. These datum plane heights are also usually referred to as above ground level however it may be above sea level or above a platform level.

height_reference_id.title: Height Reference
height_reference_id.description: The height reference frame that is used to measure the device datum plane height. E.g. onshore this is ground level i.e. the datum feature is 0.5 m above ground level. Offshore is a bit different as it can be 20 m above mean sea level or 20 m above lowest astronomical tide.

device_orientation_deg.title: Device Orientation [deg]
device_orientation_deg.description: The orientation that the remote sensing device is installed relative to north.

orientation_reference_id.title: Orientation Reference
orientation_reference_id.description: The orientation reference the remote sensing device is measured against. E.g. magnetic north.

logger_main_config.title: Logger Configuration
logger_main_config.description: This represents how the logger's main settings are configured. For example, it's sampling rate or averaging period. For remote sensing devices, such as lidar's, the device itself is considered as a logger and so these logger configuration attributes should be used to describe the lidar.

logger_oem_id.title: Logger OEM
logger_oem_id.description: This is the logger or remote sensing device manufacturer id as defined by the IEA Wind Resource Assessment Data Model Schema.

logger_model_name.title: Logger Model Name
logger_model_name.description: This is the logger or remote sensing device model name. This is usually stated in the data files from the logger in either the header or footer.

logger_serial_number.title: Logger Serial Number
logger_serial_number.description: The logger or remote sensing device serial number. This is sometimes different from the logger id.

logger_id.title: Logger Id
logger_id.description: This is the logger or remote sensing device id. It may be set by the logger programmer and may be different from the logger serial number.

logger_name.title: Logger Name
logger_name.description: The logger (or mast name) name assigned to the logger in the logger programme.

encryption_pin_or_key.title: Encryption PIN or Key
encryption_pin_or_key.description: The encryption PIN or key used to encrypt the data.

enclosure_lock_details.title: Enclosure Lock Details
enclosure_lock_details.description: Details about how to open the logger enclosure box when on site.

data_transfer_details.title: Data Transfer Details
data_transfer_details.description: Details about how the data is transferred from the logger to the recipient.

offset_from_utc_hrs.title: Offset From UTC [hr]
offset_from_utc_hrs.description: The number of hours that the logger clock is offset from UTC. E.g. -5 for Eastern Standard Time. This could also be used to capture an incorrect time programmed into the logger. E.g. a logger might be installed in upstate New York and have a UTC offset of -5. Unfortunately the mast installer programmed the incorrect time into the logger by +15 mins. Therefore the offset from UTC is -4.75.

sampling_rate_sec.title: Sampling Rate [s]
sampling_rate_sec.description: The number of seconds the logger samples data.

averaging_period_minutes.title: Averaging Period [min]
averaging_period_minutes.description: The number of minutes the logger aggregates the data over.

timestamp_is_end_of_period.title: Timestamp at End of Period
timestamp_is_end_of_period.description: Does the timestamp represent the end of the averaging period. True is for timestamp to represent the end of the averaging period and false is for timestamp to represent the start of the averaging period.
examples: true (for timestamp to represent the end of the averaging period)
false (for timestamp to represent the start of the averaging period)

clock_is_auto_synced.title: Clock is Auto-Synced
clock_is_auto_synced.description: Is the logger clock auto-synced with an internet time server to keep accurate time. True is for when the logger clock is auto-synced and false is for when the logger clock is not auto-synced.
examples: true (for when the logger clock is auto-synced)
false (for when the logger clock is not auto-synced)

lidar_config.title: Lidar Specific Configuration
lidar_config.description: The lidar specific configuration represents how the lidar's specific settings are configured. For example, if FCR is turned on.

flow_corrections_applied.title: Flow Corrections Applied
flow_corrections_applied.description: Is there any flow corrections applied to the measured data by the lidar unit, e.g. Flow Complexity Recognition (FCR) for WindCubes?

measurement_point.title: Measurement Point
measurement_point.description: This represents a point in space where a measurement takes place.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name the measurement point is commonly referred to. This is the name that is used to refer to the data in an analysis and reporting.

measurement_type_id.title: Measurement Type
measurement_type_id.description: The type of measurement been made. See more information in the examples.
examples: wind_speed  (the horizontal component of wind speed)
wind_direction  (the direction form which the wind is coming from)
air_temperature  (outdoor ambient temperature of the air)
temperature  (the temperature of a body or indoor ambient air temperature)
relative_humidity (outdoor relative humidity of the air
voltage (electrical voltage, typically the logger battery voltage)
current (electrical current, typically the logger battery current)
resistance (electrical resistance, the raw or basic measurement from many different sensors)
power (the amount of energy transferred or converted per unit of time)
energy (in physics, is the capacity for doing work. It may exist in potential, kinetic, thermal, electrical, chemical, nuclear, or other various forms.)
vertical_wind_speed (the vertical component of wind speed)
wind_speed_turbulence (the turbulence of the wind speed)
precipitation (water which falls to the ground from the atmosphere in forms of rain, snow, sleet, ice pellets, dew, frost, and hail)
ice_detection (detection of ice build up on surfaces)
global_horizontal_irradiance (the total power or instantaneous rate of energy from the sun received by a horizontal surface on Earth)
direct_normal_irradiance (the direct line of sight power or instantaneous rate of energy from the sun, excluding diffuse irradiance, received by a surface on Earth perpendicular to the sun)
diffuse_horizontal_irradiance (the power or instantaneous rate of energy from light scattered by the atmosphere, excluding direct irradiance, received by a horizontal surface on Earth)
global_tilted_irradiance (the total power or instantaneous rate of energy from the sun received by a surface on Earth with defined tilt and azimuth, fixed or sun-tracking)
global_normal_irradiance (the total power or instantaneous rate of energy from the sun received by a surface on Earth perpendicular to the sun)
albedo (or reflected solar radiation from the earth's surface, is defined as the ratio between the reflected energy and the incident energy over a unit area)
soiling_loss_index (an index of lost energy between clean and dirty PV modules, https://www.campbellsci.com/cr-pvs1 )
illuminance (measure of visible light falling onto a per unit area, typically measured in lux)
fog (is a visible aerosol consisting of tiny water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the air at or near the Earth's surface)
gps_coordinates (latitude and/or longitude as measured by a gps)
status (a status flag or other to describe the status of a sensor or object)

availability (the availability of a sensor or the presence of something in a measurement typically measured as %, e.g. '40m Data Availability (%)' or 'Proportion Of Packets with Fog (%)'. This is currently a generic catch-all for all 'availability' like metrics and may be resolved into more specific definitions in future revisions.)
quality (a measure of the quality of a measurement)
carrier_to_noise_ratio (a measure of signal strength as measured by lidar devices, http://data.windenergy.dtu.dk/ontologies/view/IEATask32Glossary/en/page/parameters.carrier_to_noise_ratio )
orientation (the direction something points or faces relative to north or other specified positions)
compass_direction (the direction as measured by a compass, therefore referenced to magnetic north)
true_north_offset (the offset something points or faces relative to true north, e.g. from a solar compass such as a Geovane)
tilt_x (the tilt of an object relative to the x-axis)
tilt_y (the tilt of an object relative to the y-axis)
tilt_z (the tilt of an object relative to the z-axis)
elevation (the height the surface of the earth is above mean sea level)
altitude (the height above mean sea level or is the angle between the sun and the observer's local horizon, also sometimes referred to as elevation)

azimuth (is the angle of the sun around the horizon, in the northern hemisphere this is usually measured from north and increasing eastward whereas in the southern hemisphere it can be measured from the south and increasing westward)
timestamp (the timestamp of when a measurement value was recorded)

height_m.title: Height [m]
height_m.description: The height (in meters) typically above ground level that the measurement is taking place. If you do not yet know the height please use null.

height_reference_id.title: Height Reference
height_reference_id.description: The height reference frame that is used to measure the height of the measurement point. E.g. onshore this is ground level i.e. the anemometer is 80 m above ground level. Offshore is a bit different as it can be 80 m above mean sea level or 80 m above lowest astronomical tide.

logger_measurement_config.title: Logger Measurement Configuration
logger_measurement_config.description: The measurement configuration that is programmed into the logging device.

slope.title: Logger Slope
slope.description: The slope programmed into the logger for this measurement. This is typically expected for anemometers and wind vanes, but not necessarily required for other sensor types.

offset.title: Logger Offset
offset.description: The offset programmed into the logger. This is typically expected for anemometers and wind vanes, but not necessarily required for other sensor types.

sensitivity.title: Logger Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity programmed into the logger. Usually used for pyranometers. It is the same as 1/slope with zero for offset.

measurement_units_id.title: Measurement Units
measurement_units_id.description: The measurement units of the values the sensor records.

height_m.title: Logger Height [m]
height_m.description: The height in meters at which the sensor is deployed, as programmed into the logger. For remote sensing devices such as lidars and sodars this is the measurement height programmed into the device where the measurement height is defined here: http://data.windenergy.dtu.dk/controlled-terminology/IEAWindTask32/parameters.measurement_height

serial_number.title: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the sensor programmed into the logger.

connection_channel.title: Connection Channel
connection_channel.description: The connection channel the sensor is wired into on the logger.

column_name.title: Column Names
column_name.description: The group of column names in the data file which relates to this sensor configuration.

column_name.title: Column Name
column_name.description: The column name in the data file which relates to this sensor configuration.

statistic_type_id.title: Statistic Type
statistic_type_id.description: The statistic, aggregation function or signal e.g. 'average' or 'maximum' that this column records.

is_ignored.title: Is Ignored
is_ignored.description: If you want to ignore this column name, set to True.

sensor.title: Sensor
sensor.description: This represents information about the sensor taking the measurements.

serial_number.title: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the sensor installed.

sensor_type_id.title: Sensor Type
sensor_type_id.description: The measurement sensor type e.g. anemometer.

instrument_poi_height_mm.title: Instrument Point of Interest Height [mm]
instrument_poi_height_mm.description: This is the physical height dimension, in mm, of the sensor's point of interest, i.e. point of measurement. This is to aid IEC mounting calculations. It is not the height above ground level at which it is deployed. For example, if the sensor is an anemometer it is the height from the bottom of the instrument to the centre of the cups. For a sonic anemometer it is the centre of the sampling volume. For a horizontal propeller anemometer it is the axis of rotation of the propellers. For a wind vane it is the top of the vane.
examples: 169 mm for a Vector A100 anemometer (https://www.windspeed.co.uk/ws/index.php?option=displaypage&op=page&Itemid=48#dimensions).

is_heated.title: Is Heated
is_heated.description: Is the sensor heated to reduce the effect of icing. This is usually relevant for wind speed and wind vane sensors. True is for when the sensor is heated and false is for when the sensor is not heated.
examples: false (if the sensor is not heated)

calibration.title: Calibration
calibration.description: The sensor calibration details. This is typically expected for anemometers, but not necessarily required for other sensor types.

slope.title: Calibration Slope
slope.description: The slope programmed into the logger.

offset.title: Calibration Offset
offset.description: The offset programmed into the logger.

sensitivity.title: Calibration Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity programmed into the logger.

report_file_name.title: Report File Name
report_file_name.description: The file name of the calibration report.

report_link.title: Report Link
report_link.description: A link to the calibration report.

date_of_calibration.title: Date of Calibration
date_of_calibration.description: The date the sensor calibration took place.

calibration_organisation.title: Calibration Organisation
calibration_organisation.description: The organisation who performed the calibration.

place_of_calibration.title: Place of Calibration
place_of_calibration.description: The unique place or wind tunnel where the calibration took place. E.g. 'place of calibration' is usually a field on a calibration certificate. If not, a combination of a unique tunnel id or serial number and the address would suffice.
examples: Windtunnel 2 of Deutsche WindGuard WindTunnel Services GmbH, Varel

uncertainty_k_factor.title: Uncertainty K Factor
uncertainty_k_factor.description: The uncertainty k factor stated in the calibration report.

reference_bin.title: Reference Bin
reference_bin.description: The reference bin for the calibration.

reference_unit.title: Reference Unit
reference_unit.description: The reference bin and uncertainty units.

uncertainty.title: Uncertainty
uncertainty.description: The uncertainty associated with this reference bin.

mounting_arrangement.title: Mounting Arrangement
mounting_arrangement.description: This describes how the sensor is mounted onto the met mast.

mast_section_geometry_uuid.title: Mast Section Geometry UUID
mast_section_geometry_uuid.description: The uuid to link this Measurement Point's mounting arrangement to the Mast Section Geometry. A UUID can be generated here https://www.uuidgenerator.net/

mounting_type_id.title: Mounting Type
mounting_type_id.description: The mounting type the sensor is mounted onto the mast e.g. an anemometer top mounted above the mast or a pair of anemometers mounted in the goal post configuration.

boom_orientation_deg.title: Boom Orientation [deg]
boom_orientation_deg.description: The boom orientation of the horizontal boom the sensor is mounted on.

vane_dead_band_orientation_deg.title: Vane Dead Band Orientation [deg]
vane_dead_band_orientation_deg.description: The wind vane dead band orientation.

orientation_reference_id.title: Orientation Reference
orientation_reference_id.description: The orientation reference the booms and vane dead band are measured against. E.g. magnetic north.

tilt_angle_deg.title: Tilt Angle [deg]
tilt_angle_deg.description: The tilt angle of either the vertical upstand the sensor is mounted on.

upstand_height_mm.title: Upstand Height [mm]
upstand_height_mm.description: The height, measured in millimeters, of the upstand.

upstand_diameter_mm.title: Upstand Diameter [mm]
upstand_diameter_mm.description: The diameter, measured in millimeters, of the upstand.

boom_diameter_mm.title: Boom Diameter [mm]
boom_diameter_mm.description: The diameter, measured in millimeters, of the boom.

boom_length_mm.title: Boom Length [mm]
boom_length_mm.description: The length, measured in millimeters, of the boom.

distance_from_mast_to_sensor_mm.title: Distance Mast to Sensor [mm]
distance_from_mast_to_sensor_mm.description: The distance, measured in millimeters, of edge of the mast to the centre of the sensor.

structure_type_id.title: Structure Type
structure_type_id.description: The type of structure that is causing an interference in the sensor's measurements.

orientation_from_mast_centre_deg.title: Orientation from Mast Centre [deg]
orientation_from_mast_centre_deg.description: The orientation of the interference structure, relative to the centre of the mast, causing an impact on the sensor's measurements.

orientation_reference_id.title: Orientation Reference
orientation_reference_id.description: The orientation reference the interference structure is measured against. E.g. magnetic north.

distance_from_mast_centre_mm.title: Distance from Mast Centre [mm]
distance_from_mast_centre_mm.description: The distance from the mast centre to the interference structure causing an impact on the sensor's measurements.
